page.title: 13Biography
page.content: A womans weelky pay was between 2/6d (12) and 5/-(25p). School needed cleans. Most men in Kippax worked at Ledston Luck pit working 6 days Â£1.32. People who worked as taylors worked out of Kippax. There were a few jobs in Kippax for young girls so most of them went into service at Wakefield or Leeds. Ladies wore black dresses and caps. Most girls went into service at 13. The railway station supplied three or four jobs. Some people worked 15 hours a day, they work 6 days a week. Farming was also common around Kippax. People either had to walk to Castleford and Leeds or pay for the bus. Women and children went potato scralting and pea pulling for 3p a sack. Kippax had 5 different bus companies. Individuals bought a bus and ran a service.
